name: Noah
short_bio: Noah built the ark to survive the flood.

name: Moses
short_bio: Moses led the Israelites out of Egypt.

name: Solomon
short_bio: Son of David and Bathsheba; famed for wisdom.

name: Joseph (son of Jacob)
age_notes: Sold by brothers at 17; died at 110
short_bio: Joseph was sold into Egypt and rose to power.

name: David
short_bio: Shepherd who became king of Israel; famous for defeating Goliath.

name: Esther
notable_events: Became queen and saved her people
short_bio: Jewish queen of Persia who saved her people.

name: Mary (mother of Jesus)
short_bio: Mother of Jesus.

name: John the Baptist
short_bio: Prophet who baptized Jesus.

name: Paul
short_bio: Originally named Saul; became Apostle Paul after conversion.

name: Peter
short_bio: One of Jesus's closest disciples; called Peter.

name: Lazarus
notable_events: Raised from the dead by Jesus
short_bio: Brother of Mary and Martha; raised from the dead.

name: Abraham
short_bio: Father of the Israelite nation.

name: Isaac
age_notes: Died at 180; born when Abraham was 100
short_bio: Son of Abraham and Sarah; father of Jacob.

name: Jacob
short_bio: Father of the 12 tribes of Israel.

name: Samuel
short_bio: Prophet and judge who anointed Israel's first kings.

name: Elijah
notable_events: Taken up by chariot of fire
short_bio: Great prophet who was taken to heaven in a chariot.

name: Jonah
short_bio: Prophet who fled God and was swallowed by a great fish.

name: Ruth
short_bio: Moabite woman who became ancestor to King David.

name: Mary Magdalene
short_bio: Witness of Jesus's resurrection.

name: Saul (first king)
short_bio: Israel's first king anointed by Samuel.

name: Daniel
short_bio: Prophet in Babylon; survived lion's den.

name: Joshua
short_bio: Successor to Moses who led Israel into Promised Land.

name: Deborah
short_bio: Prophet and judge who led Israel to victory.

name: Gideon
short_bio: Judge who defeated the Midianites with 300 men.

name: Samson
short_bio: Judge with supernatural strength; betrayed by Delilah.

name: Jeremiah
short_bio: Weeping prophet who warned of Babylon's destruction.

name: Ezekiel
short_bio: Prophet of the exile with dramatic visions.

name: Isaiah
short_bio: Major prophet who prophesied about the Messiah.

name: Job
short_bio: Righteous man who suffered but remained faithful.

name: Nehemiah
short_bio: Led rebuilding of Jerusalem's walls.

name: Ezra
short_bio: Priest and scribe who restored the Law.

name: Adam
short_bio: First human created by God.

name: Eve
short_bio: First woman; mother of all humanity.

name: Cain
short_bio: First son of Adam and Eve; killed his brother.

name: Abel
short_bio: Second son of Adam and Eve; murdered by Cain.

name: Lot
short_bio: Abraham's nephew who escaped Sodom's destruction.

name: Sarah
short_bio: Wife of Abraham and mother of Isaac.

name: Rebekah
short_bio: Wife of Isaac; mother of Jacob and Esau.

name: Rachel
short_bio: Beloved wife of Jacob; mother of Joseph.

name: Leah
short_bio: First wife of Jacob; mother of six of his sons.

name: Miriam
short_bio: Sister of Moses and Aaron; prophetess.

name: Aaron
short_bio: Brother of Moses; first high priest of Israel.

name: Caleb
short_bio: Faithful spy who trusted God's promise.

name: Elisha
short_bio: Prophet who succeeded Elijah; performed many miracles.

name: Naomi
short_bio: Mother-in-law of Ruth; returned from Moab.

name: Boaz
short_bio: Wealthy man who married Ruth.

name: Hannah
short_bio: Mother of Samuel; prayed faithfully for a son.

name: Eli
short_bio: High priest who mentored young Samuel.

name: Goliath
short_bio: Giant Philistine warrior defeated by David.

name: Jonathan
short_bio: Son of Saul and loyal friend of David.

name: Bathsheba
short_bio: Wife of Uriah then David; mother of Solomon.

name: Absalom
short_bio: Son of David who rebelled against him.

name: Elkanah
short_bio: Father of Samuel; husband of Hannah and Peninnah.

name: Mordecai
short_bio: Cousin of Esther who helped save the Jews.

name: Joah
short_bio: given name

name: Abey
short_bio: given name

name: Maro
short_bio: unisex given name

name: Aram
short_bio: male given name (Արամ)

name: Seth
notable_events: His line called upon the name of the Lord

name: Enosh
verses: people began to call upon the name of the Lord

name: Enoch (Jared's Son)
notable_events: 'Walked with God' and was taken away without seeing death

name: Methuselah
age_notes: Lived 969 years (Oldest man in the Bible)

name: Shem
notable_events: Ancestor of Abraham and the Israelites

name: Ham
notable_events: Saw his father Noah naked and was cursed (via his son Canaan)

name: Nimrod
verses: Established the kingdom of Babel and cities like Nineveh

name: Hagar
notable_events: Sent away into the wilderness twice

name: Ishmael
verses: Prophesied to be a 'wild donkey of a man'

name: Stephen
short_bio: One of the first deacons in the Jerusalem church and the first Christian martyr.

name: Nicodemus
notable_events: Visited Jesus by night to ask questions
short_bio: A Pharisee who sought Jesus' teaching and later aided in his burial.

name: Barnabas
notable_events: Sold property and gave proceeds to apostles
Partnered with Paul on missionary journeys
Advocated for Paul to the Jerusalem church
short_bio: Early Christian leader known for encouragement and missionary work with Paul.

name: Philip the Evangelist
notable_events: Chosen as one of the seven to serve
short_bio: One of the seven deacons who became a prominent evangelist in Samaria and beyond.

name: Ananias (of Damascus)
notable_events: Sent by the Lord to restore Saul's sight
short_bio: Disciple in Damascus who obeyed God's call to heal and baptize Saul (Paul).

name: Sapphira
notable_events: Conspired with husband to lie about proceeds
Struck dead after lying to apostles
short_bio: Wife of Ananias (not the Damascus disciple) who died after deceit in the early church.

name: Cornelius
notable_events: Received Peter's message and was baptized
short_bio: A Roman centurion whose conversion marked the opening of the church to Gentiles.

name: Timothy
notable_events: Traveled with Paul on missionary journeys
short_bio: Young leader mentored by Paul who served churches in Asia Minor and received pastoral guidance in epistles.

name: Titus
notable_events: Recipient of the Epistle to Titus
short_bio: Pauline companion who helped organize churches and received a pastoral epistle.

name: Judas Iscariot
notable_events: Betrayed Jesus for thirty pieces of silver
short_bio: One of Jesus' twelve disciples who betrayed him to the authorities.

name: Simon the Zealot
notable_events: Associated with the Zealot movement in some traditions
short_bio: One of the twelve apostles, distinguished in tradition by the title 'the Zealot'.

name: James (brother of Jesus)
notable_events: Brother of Jesus who led the Jerusalem church
Author of the Epistle of James
short_bio: A leading figure in the early Jerusalem church and author of the Epistle of James.

name: Jairus
notable_events: Sought Jesus to heal his daughter
short_bio: A synagogue leader whose daughter was raised to life by Jesus.

name: Zacchaeus
notable_events: Climbed a sycamore tree to see Jesus
Repented and restored what he had taken
short_bio: A short tax collector who welcomed Jesus and repented, becoming an example of restoration.

name: Good Samaritan
notable_events: Stopped to help an injured man
Used by Jesus to teach neighborly love
short_bio: The central figure in Jesus' parable who showed mercy to a stranger.

name: Ehud
short_bio: Left-handed judge who delivered Israel by killing the Moabite king Eglon.

name: Jethro
occupation: Priest of Midian, father-in-law of Moses
short_bio: Priest of Midian and Moses' father-in-law who advised him on governing Israel.

name: Epaphroditus
notable_events: Sent by Philippians to assist Paul
short_bio: A trusted companion and messenger to Paul from the church at Philippi.

name: Rhoda
notable_events: Answered the door when Peter escaped prison
Ran to tell others but was not believed at first
short_bio: A servant girl who recognized Peter's voice after his miraculous escape from prison.

name: Dodo
notable_events: Named as ancestor in David's mighty men lists
short_bio: A minor figure listed among warriors and genealogies associated with David.

name: Onesimus
notable_events: Runaway slave who became a Christian
Returned to Philemon and was reconciled through Paul's appeal
short_bio: A former slave whose conversion and reconciliation are central to Paul's letter to Philemon.

name: Philemon
notable_events: Hosted a church in his home
short_bio: A Christian host and the addressee of Paul's letter concerning Onesimus.

name: Gehazi
short_bio: Elisha's servant who was punished with leprosy for greed and deceit.

name: Huldah
notable_events: Consulted about the Book of the Law found in the temple
Delivered a prophetic message to King Josiah's delegation
short_bio: A prophetess who authenticated the Book of the Law and prophesied during Josiah's reforms.

name: Baruch
notable_events: Served as Jeremiah's scribe and companion
Associated with the preservation of Jeremiah's prophecies
short_bio: Jeremiah's scribe who recorded and preserved prophetic messages.

name: Abimelech
occupation: Philistine king; also name of Gideon's son who became king
notable_events: Interacted with Abraham and Isaac over wells
Took a wife from Shechem (Gideon's son Abimelech)
short_bio: Name borne by several rulers in the Bible; notable as a Philistine king and as Abimelech son of Gideon who seized power.

name: Achan
short_bio: Israelite who disobeyed God's command at Jericho, bringing judgment on himself and Israel.

name: Adonijah
notable_events: Son of David who attempted to claim the throne
short_bio: A son of David who sought kingship but was outmaneuvered by Solomon and later put to death.

name: Ahaz
short_bio: King of Judah known for unfaithfulness and political alliances with Assyria.

name: Amaziah
short_bio: A king of Judah who experienced military success but later fell into idolatry and was overthrown.

name: Asa
notable_events: Reformed the nation early in his reign
short_bio: King of Judah noted for early reforms and later mixed trust in God and alliances.

name: Athaliah
notable_events: Seized the throne after her son's death
short_bio: A queen who usurped the throne of Judah and led the nation into idolatry before being removed.

name: Belshazzar
notable_events: Held a profane feast using temple vessels
Saw the writing on the wall
short_bio: Last Babylonian ruler in Daniel's account who witnessed the handwriting predicting Babylon's fall.

name: Bildad
notable_events: Rebuked by God indirectly through Job's vindication
short_bio: A friend of Job who offered traditional but inadequate explanations for suffering.

name: Zophar
notable_events: Spoke harshly about Job's supposed guilt
Part of the debate on suffering
short_bio: Another of Job's friends who insisted suffering was due to sin and urged repentance.

name: Elihu
notable_events: Intervened in Job's debate after the three friends
Offered a different perspective on suffering
Spoke with passion about God's justice
short_bio: A younger interlocutor in the Book of Job who challenged both Job and his older friends.

name: Mephibosheth
notable_events: Son of Jonathan who was lame in both feet
short_bio: Jonathan's son whom David honored, restoring his inheritance and showing covenantal kindness.

name: Shadrach
notable_events: Refused to bow to Nebuchadnezzar's image
short_bio: One of three Jewish youths who trusted God and were miraculously preserved in a furnace.

name: Meshach
notable_events: Preserved in the fiery furnace with Shadrach and Abednego
short_bio: Companion of Daniel who stood firm in faith and was protected in the furnace.

name: Abednego
notable_events: Refused to worship the golden image
short_bio: One of the three who trusted God rather than bow to idolatry and was miraculously saved.

name: Uriah the Hittite
notable_events: Sent to the front and killed on David's orders
short_bio: A loyal soldier whose death was orchestrated by King David after David's adultery with Bathsheba.

name: Jephthah
notable_events: Made a tragic vow involving his daughter
short_bio: A judge who secured victory for Israel but whose rash vow brought sorrow to his household.

name: Manoah
notable_events: Received angelic announcement of Samson's birth
short_bio: Father of Samson who encountered an angel announcing his son's Nazirite birth.

name: Delilah
notable_events: Betrayed Samson by discovering the secret of his strength
short_bio: A Philistine woman who coaxed Samson into revealing his Nazirite secret, leading to his downfall.

name: Abishai
notable_events: Killed Abner's men and other enemies
short_bio: A valiant warrior in David's service and brother of Joab, known for military exploits.

name: Benaiah
notable_events: Served as commander under David and Solomon
short_bio: A trusted military leader known for courageous deeds and later service under Solomon.

name: Keturah
short_bio: A later wife of Abraham who bore him additional children and expanded his family line.

name: Phinehas
notable_events: Acted zealously against idolatry at Peor
Rewarded with a covenant of peace
short_bio: A priest noted for zealous action against idolatry and honored with a lasting covenant.

name: Eliab
notable_events: Present when Samuel came to anoint a king
Initially presumed to be chosen before David was selected
short_bio: Eldest son of Jesse who was overlooked by God when Samuel anointed David as king.

name: Abner
short_bio: A powerful military leader in Saul's time who played a key role in the transition to David's rule.

name: Joab
notable_events: Led many of David's military campaigns
short_bio: David's military commander, effective but ruthless, whose actions shaped Israel's history.

name: Melchizedek
occupation: King of Salem, priest of God Most High
notable_events: Type of priesthood referenced in Psalms and Hebrews
short_bio: Mysterious priest-king who blessed Abraham and serves as a model for Christ's priesthood in the New Testament.

name: Simeon (the devout man)
notable_events: Blessed the infant Jesus in the temple
short_bio: A devout man who recognized the infant Jesus as the promised consolation and prophesied over him.

name: Anna (prophetess)
notable_events: Served in the temple with fasting and prayer
Recognized and spoke about the child Jesus
short_bio: An elderly prophetess who worshiped in the temple and testified about Jesus to those awaiting redemption.

name: Cleopas
occupation: Disciple on the road to Emmaus
notable_events: Walked with the risen Jesus on the road to Emmaus
Recognized Jesus in the breaking of bread
short_bio: One of the two disciples who encountered the risen Jesus on the road to Emmaus and later reported the experience.

name: Matthias
notable_events: Selected by lot among the disciples
short_bio: The disciple chosen to fill the vacancy among the twelve apostles after Judas' betrayal.

name: Lydia
notable_events: First European convert recorded in Acts
Hosted Paul and companions in her home
short_bio: A businesswoman from Thyatira whose conversion and hospitality supported Paul's mission in Europe.

name: Priscilla
short_bio: A prominent early Christian teacher and missionary who partnered with her husband Aquila in ministry.

name: Aquila
notable_events: Partnered with Paul in tentmaking and ministry
Hosted a church in his home
short_bio: A close coworker of Paul who hosted and supported early Christian gatherings with his wife Priscilla.

name: Apollos
notable_events: Was instructed further by Priscilla and Aquila
short_bio: An eloquent and knowledgeable teacher who played a significant role in early church instruction and ministry.

name: Sergius Paulus
notable_events: Converted after hearing Paul's message in Cyprus
short_bio: A Roman official on Cyprus who responded to Paul's preaching and turned to faith.

name: Simon of Cyrene
occupation: Bystander compelled to carry the cross
notable_events: Pressed into service to carry Jesus' cross
Father of Alexander and Rufus mentioned in Mark
short_bio: A passerby compelled to bear Jesus' cross on the way to Golgotha, later remembered by his sons' names.

name: Bartimaeus
notable_events: Called out to Jesus for mercy
short_bio: A blind man who boldly called to Jesus and was healed, exemplifying persistent faith.

name: Jair
notable_events: Had thirty sons who rode thirty donkeys
short_bio: A judge of Israel noted for his household's wealth and influence during his tenure.

name: Nabal
notable_events: Saved from David's vengeance by Abigail
Died after learning of his folly
short_bio: A wealthy but foolish man whose refusal to aid David nearly brought disaster on his household until Abigail intervened.

name: Gomer
notable_events: Her unfaithfulness served as a prophetic symbol of Israel's infidelity
short_bio: Hosea's wife whose life illustrated Israel's unfaithfulness and God's redeeming love.

name: Hosea
notable_events: Used his marriage as a prophetic sign
short_bio: A prophet who used personal and symbolic actions to call Israel back to covenant faithfulness.

name: Nahum
notable_events: Called for justice against Assyrian cruelty
short_bio: A minor prophet who foretold Nineveh's destruction as judgment for its violence.

name: Obadiah
short_bio: Author of a short prophetic book denouncing Edom and affirming God's justice for Israel.

name: Zechariah (prophet)
short_bio: A post-exilic prophet who encouraged restoration and offered visions pointing to future hope.

name: Malachi
notable_events: Called Israel to faithfulness after the exile
Addressed issues of worship and justice
short_bio: The final book of the Old Testament, calling God's people to renewed covenantal faithfulness.

name: Andrew
short_bio: Brother of Peter and one of the first disciples called by Jesus.

name: James son of Alphaeus
short_bio: One of the Twelve apostles, distinguished from James son of Zebedee.

name: Thaddaeus
notable_events: Asked Jesus why He would reveal Himself to the disciples and not the world
short_bio: One of the Twelve apostles, also called Jude or Lebbaeus.

name: Bartholomew
notable_events: Recognized Jesus as Son of God
short_bio: A sincere seeker who became one of the Twelve apostles, also known as Nathanael.

name: Philip (the Apostle)
notable_events: Asked Jesus to show the Father
short_bio: One of the Twelve apostles known for inviting others to meet Jesus.

name: Thomas
notable_events: Declared Jesus 'My Lord and my God'
short_bio: Apostle known for his honest doubt and later profound confession of faith.

name: Silas
short_bio: A leading member of the early church who traveled with Paul on missionary journeys.

name: John Mark
notable_events: Author of the Gospel of Mark
short_bio: Companion of Paul and Barnabas and traditionally regarded as the author of the Gospel of Mark.

name: Simeon called Niger
notable_events: Part of the leadership team in Antioch
short_bio: A leader in the multicultural Antioch church who helped commission Paul and Barnabas.

name: Lucius of Cyrene
short_bio: One of the prophets and teachers in the Antioch church who supported early missions.

name: Manaen
short_bio: A prominent believer raised with Herod Antipas who became a leader in the Antioch church.

name: Agabus
short_bio: A prophet in the early church known for accurate predictions about famine and Paul's imprisonment.

name: Eutychus
notable_events: Fell from a window during Paul's sermon
short_bio: A young man who fell asleep during Paul's preaching and was miraculously restored to life.

name: Trophimus
short_bio: An Ephesian believer who traveled with Paul and is mentioned in several letters.

name: Aristarchus
short_bio: A Macedonian believer who endured hardship with Paul and traveled with him to Rome.

name: Sopater
short_bio: A Berean believer who accompanied Paul on his travels and supported his ministry.

name: Jason
short_bio: A Thessalonian believer who risked his safety to host Paul and Silas during persecution.

name: Stephanas
short_bio: A respected early convert whose household was known for dedicated service to the church.

name: Phoebe
notable_events: Carrier of the letter to the Romans
short_bio: A deacon and benefactor in the early church who delivered Paul's letter to the Romans.

name: Chloe
notable_events: Her household reported divisions in Corinth
short_bio: A respected woman whose household informed Paul about issues in the Corinthian church.

name: Erastus
notable_events: Held a civic office in Corinth
short_bio: A high-ranking official in Corinth who supported Paul's ministry.

name: Crispus
notable_events: Believed in the Lord with his household
short_bio: A synagogue leader in Corinth who converted under Paul's preaching.

name: Sosthenes
notable_events: Later greeted as a brother in Christ
short_bio: A synagogue leader who later became a believer and co-sender of 1 Corinthians.

name: Gallio
short_bio: A Roman governor who refused to prosecute Paul, setting a legal precedent for early Christians.

name: Elymas
short_bio: A false prophet who opposed the gospel and was struck blind by Paul’s rebuke.

name: Demetrius the Silversmith
notable_events: Started a riot in Ephesus over idol trade
short_bio: A craftsman who incited a riot against Paul to protect the idol-making industry in Ephesus.

name: Alexander the Coppersmith
short_bio: A metalworker who caused Paul significant harm and opposed his ministry.

name: Onesiphorus
short_bio: A faithful believer who encouraged Paul during imprisonment and served the church sacrificially.

name: Tychicus
short_bio: A trusted messenger who carried Paul’s letters and strengthened early churches.
